{"title": "Battle for Normandy", "title_search": "battle for normandy", "title_keyword": "battle for normandy", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/battle-for-normandy/", "summary": "HERE IS THE WARGAMER'S DREAM VACATION PACKAGE: 25 DAYS ON THE NORTHERN COAST OF FRANCE.  BATTLE FOR NORMANDY is the faithful recreation of D-Day and the 24 days that followed it. To do justice to this great World War II battle, we've made sure every important historical detail has been realistically and accurately programmed into the game.  As the Supreme Allied Commander (Eisenhower, step aside!), your task is to establish beachheads on Utah, Omaha, Juno, Gold, and Sword, consolidate them, then move out your forces to capture such strategic towns as Cherbourg and Caen.  Besides dealing with the fierce German coastal and land defenses, you are also challenged by the logistics of battle. Specifically, you must juggle your limited shipping to provide either more troops, fuel, general or combat supplies. Finding the optimum balance is difficult enough - until you realize you must also take into account the vagaries of weather. Inclement weather can turn your best-laid plans to shambles.", "genre": ["Strategy"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": null, "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/3/6-1-638118-13.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/3/6-1-638118-13.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": null, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["SSI (Publisher)", "Tactical Design (Developer)"], "platforms": ["PC"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Dominion (Canceled)", "title_search": "dominion canceled", "title_keyword": "dominion canceled", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/dominion-canceled/", "summary": "The creator of DOMINION, David Allen, is known for his previously released games MORDOR and DEMISE. For those of you who aren't familiar with these titles, they have become cult classics in the RPG industry; custom and specialized games that tend to a unique breed of gamer.  DOMINION is the next evolution of those games - it evolves the typical RPG/Action game to become much more interesting to the common gamer, or in this case console gamer.  Players want to play a good game, and be immersed into a visually stunning world that's not only believable, but also fun. More importantly, they want to feel as if they are accomplishing something, and have the ability to share it with others.  DOMINION will deliver exactly that. The team at Pharaoh is generating a completely new product to bring one of the richest action-oriented RPG Xbox titles to life.  The basic premise of DOMINION is immersion, experience, development, and community. Players will be able to work on their characters privately (in SP mode) and then play those same characters with their friends. This is a feature that has been sought after by gamers for years, the ability to play and build your characters up on your own, then take those characters into the active worlds of others. DOMINION will allow this.", "genre": ["MMORPG"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": null, "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-15977-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-15977-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": [], "platforms": ["PC", "Xbox"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Shaun White Snowboarding", "title_search": "shaun white snowboarding", "title_keyword": "shaun white snowboarding", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/shaun-white-snowboarding/", "summary": "Developed in close collaboration with Shaun White, Olympic Gold Medalist and eight-time X Games Gold Medalist, Shaun White Snowboarding allows players to enter a world of total freedom, where they can create their own experience and choose how, where, and with whom they want to ride. Open World Mountains: Choose how you ride in open-world mountains across the world. Conquer extreme peak conditions, create your own paths in the back country, or compete with fellow riders in the terrain parks. Your Friends Are Always Around: Play in a world where your friends are always around. Do your own runs on mountains populated by real gamers, or join your friends for a quick session from any mountain. More than Just Snowboarding: Have fun with your friends on and off the board! Throw snowballs, hike to access secret spots, film your friends doing ripping tricks. You can also upload your videos online to share with the world. Ride Your Way: Express yourself through tricks, riding styles, and highly customizable avatars \u2013 both in single-player and in the online world. Use the intuitive dual analog control to pull off a huge variety of tricks that express your style. Next-Gen Technology: Built on the Assassin's Creed engine, this game creates a massive world with gorgeous visuals and realistic NPC interactions. This is also the first time a snowboarding game is completely driven by physics instead of animation. Authentic Snowboarding: Ubisoft has worked closely with Shaun White to infuse the gaming experience with authenticity, personality and humor. Shaun is a friend and mentor in the game, and will help you with your skills. And, if you are deemed worthy, you may even be able to play as Shaun in the game. {"title": "Galactic Civilizations: Altarian Prophecy", "title_search": "galactic civilizations altarian prophecy", "title_keyword": "galactic civilizations altarian prophecy", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/galactic-civilizations-altarian-prophecy/", "summary": "Galactic Civilizations: Altarian Prophecy is an expansion pack to Stardock's award winning space strategy game, Galactic Civilizations. The expansion pack adds a host of new features, content, and other enhancements to the game to add depth and much greater replayability. In the late 22nd century, humanity came into contact with 5 major alien civilizations. These civilizations were called, the Drengin Empire, the Torian Confederation, the Arcean Empire, the Yor Collective and the Altarian Republic. Of these 5, the Altarians were the most curious to us. Not for their cultural traits or their technology but because they happened to look human. How was this possible? The \"Altarian Prophecy\" is a campaign that takes the player on a multi-game journey to solve the mystery alluded to in Galactic Civilizations. In doing so, it introduces two new civilizations: The Dominion of the Korx and the Drath. These two civilizations hold the secret to Altaria's past, but worse, they know the Altarian Prophecy that for tells the destruction of the galaxy that is connected to Altaria's past.
